text.p: Here are highlights from Polish newspapers this morning.
RZECZPOSPOLITA
- The Kedzierzyn-Kozle-based ZBA Kedzierzyn chemicals equipment maker has received an International Standards Organisation (ISO)-9002 certificate for management quality, valid for three years.
- Polish fishermen have not exhausted their cod, sprat and herring fishing quotas on the Baltic sea this year, the Slupsk-based maritime administration office said.
- Telekomunikacja Polska SA, Poland's telecom monopolist, will service telecom lines along the Yamal-Western Europe gas pipeline, TPSA's recent agreement with EuRoPol Gaz said.

- The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) has presented a 12.5 year, $15 million credit to the Warsaw-based WRSR SA soft commodities' exchange to be built next to the Warsaw-Poznan motorway.

- More than 100 businessmen from the Czech Republic, Poland and Slovakia took part in a one-day economic forum in Ostrava, the Czech Republic, on problems of trade exchange, customs tariffs and banking systems within the CEFTA countries.

- The Polish-French BISE bank has acceded to the SWIFT international financial telecom organisation, which allows for 48 hour global money transfers as well as sales of securities and travellers' cheques.
NOWA EUROPA
- Motorway construction will bring revenues to the state treasury, Transport Minister Boguslaw Liberadzki said. By 1998 Poland's motorways should be over 1500 km long.

- By 2000 the Warsaw-based Daewoo-FSO passenger car plant will produce 350,000 cars while the Lublin-based Daewoo automaker will produce 150,000 commercial vehicles, the Daewoo Corporation president Kim Woo-Choong said. Eventually, the Polish-based plants will make 25% of the corporation's output.
- Italy's ENEL holding wants to participate in the planned construction of a hydroelectric power station in Ciechocinek, central Poland.

- The Bank Handlowy Capital Operations Centre (BH COK) has recommended holding the Rafako boiler maker's shares longterm as Poland's envisaged energy sector's modernisation outlays should reach $1.5 billion annually by 2000.
GAZETA WYBORCZA

- Poland's processed goods' sales declined in November and December forecasts show a further decline in the sales of leather, textiles and chemical goods, a recent report by the Central Statistical Office (GUS) said.
- Finland's Mastera tanker has delivered 130,000 tonnes of oil, contracted by the Petrochemia Plock refinery, to the port of Gdansk.
- Around 70 Polish-based companies exhibited their products at the alcoholic beverage fair organised by the Centrum Targowe Kielce trading centre in Kielce, southern Poland.
ZYCIE
- An unexpectedly high growth in Poland's passenger car sales may use up all 1997 customs free import quotas by the end of January, car retailers said.
-- Warsaw Newsroom +48 22 653 9700
